behemoths.name: Gnasher
behemoths.description: Gnasher is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Monstrous Verge.
behemoths.interupting: The Gnasher can be Interrupted during its charge where it angrily bites anything in its path. This attack is telegraphed by a short jump, followed by the dash immediately after it touches the ground.

Head: • Gnasher Hide
Tail: • Gnasher Hide

behemoths.name: Shrike
behemoths.description: Graceful, precise, and predatory. It glides through the night skies searching for prey to descend upon.
behemoths.interupting: The Shrike can be interrupted during its gliding attack where it first creates some distance by charging, then flies towards its prey, attempting to maim it with its talons.

behemoths.name: Quillshot
behemoths.description: Quillshot is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Monstrous Verge and The Yonder Keys.
behemoths.interupting: Although not a conventional interruption, the Quillshot can be forced out of its quill barrage when enraged. Dealing sufficient damage (ie. reaching a damage threshold) will cause an interrupt, although it is difficult to pull off.

Head: • Quillshot Hide
Tail: • Quillshot Hide

behemoths.name: Skarn
behemoths.description: Skarn is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Monstrous Verge and The Yonder Keys.
behemoths.interupting:
The Skarn has two windows during which it can be interrupted.

The first is when it stands up on its hind legs, exposing its belly. Hitting it hard enough will result in it falling over, cancelling the attack and briefly stunning it. Beware as any Slayers standing behind the Skarn will take damage from the Behemoth falling over.

The second is during its spin attack. Due to the nature of this attack it is recommended to use ranged means of disruption such as a War Pike or Sword, as missing a Hammer or Axe attack could end in the Slayer receiving massive amounts of damage. If interrupted, the spin attack will abruptly end and the Skarn will be briefly staggered.

behemoths.name: Charrogg
behemoths.description: Charrogg is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Yonder Keys.
behemoths.interupting: Charogg is not interuptable

Head: • Charrogg Hide
Tail: • Charrogg Hide

behemoths.name: Embermane
behemoths.description: Unpredictable, explosive, and savage, the Embermane seethes with blaze aether. Embermane boasts a razor sharp horn, claws that will turn a slayer to ribbons, and unsettling speed.
behemoths.interupting:
The Embermane can be interrupted during its charge. Before charging the Embermane will crouch down, almost as if prowling, then dash towards its victim, attempting to gore them with its horn or disembowel them with its claws. If hit on the head during this charge, it'll be forcefully cancelled and briefly stunned.
It is possible to also interrupt its shorter charges, although this is far more difficult due to how short they are.

Head: • Emberhorn
Tail: • Burning Tailspike

behemoths.name: Skraev
behemoths.description: Skraev is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Yonder Keys.
behemoths.interupting: The Skraev can be interrupted during its gliding attack where it first creates some distance by charging, then flies towards its prey, attempting to maim it with its talons.

behemoths.description: Drask is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Yonder Keys.

behemoths.interupting: Pangar can be interrupted by striking it from the front while it is rolling forward. It will not be interrupted if struck from another side.

behemoths.name: Stormclaw
behemoths.description: Stormclaw is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Uncharted Reaches.
behemoths.interupting:
The Stormclaw can be interrupted during its forward charge, similarly to Embermane. Stormclaw will always perform this charge after placing the final pylon of the electric fence trap.
The Stormclaw fires off Shock balls that can be redirected at it that will do damage, yet they show no damage numbers

Head:
• Magnetooth
• Glinttooth (rare drop)
Tail:
• Capacitail
• Charged Tail (rare drop)

behemoths.name: Kharabak
behemoths.description: Kharabak is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Yonder Keys.
behemoths.interupting: The Kharabak can be interrupted during its forward charge while it is scraping one claw along the ground. The start of this charge is signaled by Kharabak creating some distance and then briefly flying upwards before moving forward. While enraged, it usually does this move twice in succession.

behemoths.name: Shockjaw Nayzaga
behemoths.description: Shockjaw Nayzaga is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Maelstrom.
behemoths.interupting: Nayzaga can be interrupted by destroying the large spine structure during its aethercharged state. Note that this structure cannot be damaged without first removing the barrier, which can be destroyed by reflecting an electrical orb into it. Alternatively, the shield can be broken with melee attacks, although Insulated +6 is required, as the shield causes Shocked status. It is therefore highly recommended that slayers bring Insulated gear.

All:
• Shockjaw Hide
• Charged Shockjaw Hide (rare drop)
Head:

• Charged Spine (rare drop)
• Sparking Spine (epic drop)

behemoths.name: Razorwing Kharabak
behemoths.description: Razorwing Kharabak is one of the Behemoths in the world of Dauntless. It can be found in The Maelstrom.
behemoths.interupting:
The Razorwing Kharabak can be interrupted during its forward charge while it is scraping one claw along the ground. The start of this charge is signaled by Kharabak creating some distance and then briefly flying upwards before moving forward. While enraged, it usually does this move twice in succession.
Notably, Razorwing seems to use this move much less frequently than regular Kharabak. Slayers can usually count on it at least twice while it is enraged.

cells.name: Stunning Vigour
cells.description: Restores some health whenever a Behemoth is staggered.
cells.level01: Heal for 50 whenever a Behemoth is Staggered
cells.level02: Heal for 75 whenever a Behemoth is Staggered
cells.level03: Heal for 100 whenever a Behemoth is Staggered
cells.level04: Heal for 125 whenever a Behemoth is Staggered
cells.level05: Heal for 150 whenever a Behemoth is Staggered
cells.level06: Heal for 200 whenever a Behemoth is Staggered

cells.name: Sturdy
cells.description: Prevents being staggered on a cooldown.
cells.level01: Prevents you from being staggered (120 second cooldown)
cells.level02: Prevents you from being staggered (100 second cooldown)
cells.level03: Prevents you from being staggered (80 second cooldown)
cells.level04: Prevents you from being staggered (60 second cooldown)
cells.level05: Prevents you from being staggered (40 second cooldown)
cells.level06: Prevents you from being staggered (15 second cooldown)

cells.name: Swift
cells.description: Increases Movement Speed when your weapon is sheathed.
cells.level01: While sheathed, increases Movement Speed by 5%
cells.level02: While sheathed, increases Movement Speed by 10%
cells.level03: While sheathed, increases Movement Speed by 15%
cells.level04: While sheathed, increases Movement Speed by 20%
cells.level05: While sheathed, increases Movement Speed by 25%
cells.level06:
While sheathed, increases Movement Speed by 30%
	  Also affects other nearby Slayers.

cells.name: Tough
cells.description: Increases Max Health.
cells.level04: Increases Max Health by 250
cells.level05: Increases Max Health by 350
cells.level06: Increases Max Health by 500

cells.name: Vampiric
cells.description: Restores some health whenever a Behemoth part is Wounded.
cells.level01: Heal for 50 whenever a Behemoth is Wounded
cells.level02: Heal for 75 whenever a Behemoth is Wounded
cells.level03: Heal for 100 whenever a Behemoth is Wounded
cells.level04: Heal for 125 whenever a Behemoth is Wounded
cells.level05: Heal for 150 whenever a Behemoth is Wounded
cells.level06: Heal for 200 whenever a Behemoth is Wounded

cells.name: Warmth
cells.description: Protects against Chilled and Frozen status effects.
cells.level01: Reduces duration of Frozen status by 30%
cells.level02: Reduces duration of Frozen status by 60%
cells.level04:
Reduces duration of Chilled status by 30%
	  Immune to being Frozen
cells.level05:
Reduces duration of Chilled status by 60%
	  Immune to being Frozen
cells.level06:
Immune to being Frozen
	  Immune to being Chilled

cells.name: Weighted Strikes
cells.description: Adds a flat amount of Stagger damage on hit. At later ranks, allows more weapon attacks to interrupt.
cells.level04: +20 Stagger Damage on Hit +200 Stagger after dodging through an attack
cells.level05: +30 Stagger Damage on Hit +200 Stagger after dodging through an attack
cells.level06:
+40 Stagger Damage on Hit +400 Stagger after dodging through an attack
	  Ranged swings and missiles interrupt unstable Behemoth attacks

cells.name: Wild Frenzy
cells.description: Increases Attack Speed when at low health.
cells.level01: When under 30% health, increase attack speed by 5%
cells.level02: When under 30% health, increase attack speed by 8%
cells.level03: When under 30% health, increase attack speed by 12%
cells.level04: When under 50% health, increase attack speed by 16%
cells.level05: When under 50% health, increase attack speed by 20%
cells.level06: When under 50% health, increase attack speed by 25%

exotics.name: The Hunger
exotics.description: The Hunger is a craftable Exotic weapon in Dauntless. It is crafted from Shrowd reagents.
exotics.uniqueeffect:
• Up to 25% increased damage as your meter increases

• Activate at max meter to enter a feast state,
   dealing 75% increase damage for 15 seconds,
   but taking damage after each hit.

• Activate again during feast state to unleash an Umbral attack
   to regain lost health

exotics.name: The Godhand
exotics.description: The Godhand is a craftable Exotic weapon in Dauntless. It is crafted from Rezakiri reagents. (picture is a placeholder just like in-game)
exotics.uniqueeffect: • Channel a beam that deals increasing damage, up to 200%, while it continues to hit a target.

exotics.name: Tragic Echo
exotics.description: Tragic Echo is a piece of craftable Exotic armour in Dauntless. It is crafted from Shrowd reagents.
exotics.uniqueeffect: • Upon your first death, become a shadow clone that deals 100% increased damage for 15 seconds

exotics.name: Prismatic Grace
exotics.description: Prismatic Grace is a piece of craftable Exotic armour in Dauntless. It is crafted from Rezakiri reagents.
exotics.uniqueeffect:
•After reviving another player, grant them a Radiant Prism that blocks incoming damage for 5 seconds.

• The first time you take lethal damage, gain a Radiant Prism that blocks incoming damage for 10 seconds.

• While active, reviving another player fully restores both players but removes the Prism even at full danger.

islands.name: Rook's Isle
islands.description: A small island of little note that's far from major shipping or settlements

islands.name: Aulric's Refuge
islands.description: A historic island used for Slayer camps during the construction of Ramsgate. named for the city's founder, famed explorer Aulric Maas.

islands.name: Iron Falls
islands.description: An ore-rich island that was once heavily mined, Iron Falls was the source of many raw materials during Ramsgate's early boom years.

islands.name: Burning Rose
islands.description: A recent arrival in the Ram formation, the island of Burning Rose is a warm, dry island rich in blaze aether. It may have once been home to an Andari settlement.

islands.name: Sandrian's Stone
islands.description: Behemoths have consumed much of this island's original archonite deposits, causing its elevation to drop precipitously.

islands.name: Coldrunner Key
islands.description: This frozen island has drifted into the Ram formation from the cold depths of the Sky Below.

islands.name: Frostmarch
islands.description: The Orrery believes Frostmarch is an undeveloped chunk of pre-Upheaval terrain that was frozen in time - literally - many centuries ago.

islands.name: Relevation Rock
islands.description: A forested isle that servers as a vantage point from the charted skies into the swirling Maelstrom. The explorers who named it found the storm to be a revelatory experience.

islands.name: Underwald
islands.description: A dangerous forest isle on a course that brushes up against the Maelstrom. Underwald is occupied by Behemoths that feed off the storm's chaotic power.

islands.name: Dyadic Drift
islands.description: An island suffused with alternating currents of corrosive umbral aether and blinding radiant energy, this bizarre interloper in the Shattered Isles is home to terrifying Behemoths few Slayers have ever seen - let alone survived.

islands.name: Amber-6
islands.description: An arid island that has drifted into the Ram formation for a short time.

islands.name: Viridian-12
islands.description: A forested island that has drifted into the Ram formation for a short time.

islands.name: Cobalt-4
islands.description: A frozen island that has drifted into the Ram formation for a short time.

islands.name: Vermillion-18
islands.description: An arid island that has drifted into the Ram formation for a short time.

islands.name: Cerulean-22
islands.description: A frozen island that has drifted into the Ram formation for a short time.

islands.name: Emerald-2
islands.description: A forested island that has drifted into the Ram formation for a short time.

islands.name: Viridian-14
islands.description: A forested island that has drifted into the Ram formation for a short time.

islands.name: Amber-00
islands.description: An arid island that has drifted into the Ram formation for a short time.

islands.name: Cobalt-17
islands.description: A frozen island that has drifted into the Ram formation for a short time.

lanterns.name: Recruit's Lantern
lanterns.hold: Disperses aether that allows the Slayer to track the Behemoth.

lanterns.name: Drask's Fury
lanterns.hold: Fires a lightning bolt in a direction that deals 200 Shock damage multiple times as it passes through a Behemoth.

lanterns.name: Embermane's Rapture
lanterns.hold: Create a fire ball in front of you that explodes after 5 seconds, dealing 750 Blaze damage to all nearby Behemoths.

lanterns.name: Pangar's Resolve
lanterns.hold: Create a frost pillar in front of you that deals 940 Frost damage to all nearby Behemoths over 12 seconds.

lanterns.name: Shrike's Zeal
lanterns.hold: Creates an aura that grants nearby slayers 15% increased movespeed and attack speed for 15 seconds.

lanterns.name: Skarn's Defiance
lanterns.instant: Grants a 200 hit point shield for 4 seconds.
lanterns.hold: Surrounds the slayer in swirling stone that deals 720 damage to all nearby Behemoths over 12 seconds.
